DOC.brief_summary: These days, there is higher proportion of elderly cancer patients. Most of them have comorbidities, borderline performance status and nutritional status. The discontinuation of chemotherapy due to unbearable toxicities was not uncommon. Comprehensive geriatric assessment might be beneficial in selection of suitable elderly patients for chemotherapy administration.
DOC.brief_title: Predisposing Factors Associated With Chemotherapy Toxicity in Elderly Cancer Patients
DOC.detailed_description: The patients with the age more than 70 years old who scheduled for chemotherapy were enrolled. Geriatric assessment was performed before starting chemotherapy. The toxicity will be recorded prospectively. Predisposing factors of grade 3 and 4 toxicity will be reported.
DOC.criteria: more than 70 years of age plan to receive first cycle of chemotherapy histologically or cytologically proved of cancer patients who have concurrent chemoradiotherapy patients who received local chemotherapy
